meanings.definition: A style of music characterized by syncopated rhythms and a lively, jaunty tempo.
meanings.sent1: The band played cheerful ragtime tunes at the park.
meanings.sent2: I love listening to the upbeat ragtime melodies on the radio.
meanings.sent3: The ragtime music made everyone tap their feet in joy.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like a lively ragtime beat.
meanings.sent5: The ragtime rhythm was so infectious, it stayed in my mind all day.

meanings.definition: A piece of music written in ragtime style.
meanings.sent1: She composed a catchy ragtime for the school talent show.
meanings.sent2: The pianist performed a classic ragtime at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The ragtime piece had the audience clapping along in delight.
meanings.sent4: The notes of the ragtime danced off the sheet music.
meanings.sent5: Listening to the ragtime felt like taking a musical journey back in time.

meanings.definition: To play or compose music in the style of ragtime.
meanings.sent1: He would often ragtime on the piano during family gatherings.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys ragtiming on her guitar in the evenings.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to ragtime along with the music on the stereo.
meanings.sent4: His fingers moved swiftly as he ragtimed a new tune.
meanings.sent5: Ragtiming always brings a smile to her face, no matter the day.
